member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.Disconnect
member.summary: Closes the single existing connection to the messaging server.
member.remarks: The Connection object is not deleted upon a disconnect, but Connection.Connected property will return false.
member.exception: Thrown in case of an internal or a network problem.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.GetConnection
member.summary: Returns the internal single instance of the Connection object.
member.returns: A reference to the Connection object for this session.

member.name: P:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.Connected
member.summary: Checks to see if a messaging server connection exists and is active. This is a convenient method to check connection status without having to acquire the Connection object.
member.returns: true if the connection is still alive, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.StopServer(System.String)
member.summary: Shuts down an existing online server. This is a convenient method to shutdown an online server object without having to acquire the Server object.
member.param: ID of the server to shut down.
member.remarks: If a server with the specified ID does not exist, this function does nothing.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.StartServer(System.String,Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ServerType)
member.summary: Starts a Rimage sever on a specific computer, specified by server type. This is a convenient method to start up a Server object without having to acquire the Connection object.
member.remarks: This method is asynchronous - it returns as soon as it initiates the server start process, which could take a while. To check if the intended server actually starts, use ISessionStatusListener to monitor server state. If a server with the specific host name and server type is already running, this method does nothing.
member.param: Name of the computer on which to start the server.
Type of the server to start - ProductionServerType or ImagingServerType.
member.exception: Thrown when the server name is invalid, the server does not exist, or the server is in an error state.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.GetServer(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a reference to a specific Server object with the given ID. This is a convenient method to get a Server object without having to acquire the Connection object.
member.param: Server ID for the intended server.
member.returns: The intended Server object if successful, NULL if no such server exists.
member.exception: Thrown if the server ID is invalid.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.RecoverDurableJobsOfClient(System.String)
member.summary: Recovers all previously in process jobs, for all connections of the specified clientId.
member.param: The clientId of the recovered jobs that were processed. If the clientId is NULL or empty, and there has never been a connection, the effect of calling RecoverDurableJobsOfClient() is the same as calling RecoverDurableJobs(), all jobs of all clilents and all connections are recovered.
member.returns: Enumerator of recovered job ids for all connections of the specified clientId.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.RecoverDurableJobs
member.summary: Recovers all previously in process jobs of all connections and all clients.
member.remarks: This method recovers job statuses for jobs that were in process when the caller application either shutdown or disconnected.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.SubmitDurableJob(Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Job)
member.summary: Submits a job for processing, with the option of recovering statuses in case of a shutdown.
member.remarks: This is a convenient method for client to submit a Job without having to acquire the Connection object. Rapid API validates parameters set on the job for correctness before it sends the job to the servers for processing.
member.param: Created job object through various Job creation methods of ClientSession.
member.exception: Thrown in one of the following cases: No valid connection, job object is null, the job is already in process, job validation fails, or internal error.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.SubmitJob(Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Job)
member.summary: Submits a job for processing.
member.remarks: This is a convenient method for client to submit a Job without having to acquire the Connection object. Rapid API validates parameters set on the job for correctness before it sends the job to the servers for processing.
member.param: Created job object through various Job creation methods of ClientSession.
member.exception: Thrown in one of the following cases: no valid connection, job object is NULL, the job is already in process, job validation fails, or internal error.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession.GetInstance
member.summary: Static method which creates or returns an already created instance of a SingleConnectionSession class.
member.remarks: Caller should not delete this object, Rapid API will destroy the object at DLL unload time.
member.returns: The single instance of SingleConnectionSession for the application.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.SingleConnectionSession
member.summary: The only subclass of ClientSession. This class encapsulates the "single messaging connection at a time" paradigm.

remarks.para: This class is never instantiated by the caller directly. Call the static method SingleConnectionSession.GetInstance() to get an instance of a session.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ClientSession.SetDefaultJobListener(Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IJobStatusListener,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the default job listener for asynchronously receiving job progress statuses.
member.remarks: A job listener can also be set with the specific job object.
member.param: An object of a class that implements the IJobStatusListener interface.
The thread ID that the caller intends to have the listener called in. The thread should be a UI thread.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ClientSession.SetDefaultJobListener(Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IJobStatusListener,Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.CallbackOnMainUIThread)
member.summary: Sets the default job listener for asynchronously receiving job progress statuses.
member.remarks: A job listener can also be set with the specific job object.
member.param: An object of a class that implements the IJobStatusListener interface.

A flag to indicate if the caller intends to have the listener called in the main UI thread of the client application, defaulted to CallbackOnMainUIThread.True. For non-UI applications, this should always be CallbackOnMainUIThread.False.
member.exception: Thrown when callbackType is true but no UI thread is found in the application.

member.param: An object of a class that implements the ISessionStatusListener interface.
The thread ID that the caller intends to have the listener called in. The thread should be a UI thread.
member.exception: Thrown when callbackUIThreadId is an invalid thread ID or the thread does not have a UI window attached.

member.param: An object of a class that implements the ISessionStatusListener interface.

A flag to indicate if the caller intends to have the listener called in the main UI thread of the client application, defaulted to CallbackOnMainUIThread.True. For non-UI applications, this should always be CallbackOnMainUIThread.False.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ClientSession.Connect(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Connects to the Rimage messaging server. A connection has to be established prior to submitting jobs.
member.param: An ID string that uniquely identifies the client application. Because clientId might be used as part of file name, it must not contain any character in ' \r\n\t<>:"/\|?*=' (note the first space). The length of clientId itself is limited to 71 characters, and the total length of clientId and hostName can not be longer than 72 characters. If clientId is NULL or empty, the current application name will be used.

Computer name hosting the messaging server. Defaulted to "localhost". Because hostName might be used as part of file name, it must not contain any character in ' \r\n\t<>:"/\|?*=' (note the first space). The length of hostName itself is limited to 71 characters, and the total length of clientId and hostName can not be longer than 72 characters.
The port messaging server is listening on. Defaulted to "4664".
member.returns: A reference to a new Connection object if successful, otherwise a RimageException is thrown.
member.exception: Thrown when connection is not available or already connected, or when host or port are invalid, or the connection cannot be established. Or if clientId and/or hostName contain excluded characters above or are too long.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ClientSession
member.summary: Working with the Rapid API starts with initiating a client session with the Rimage system. The ClientSession class is the base class for all sessions. It exposes methods that are common to all types of sessions, such as job creation, enumerating over jobs, servers, and alerts, and setting job and session listeners.

remarks.para: An application maintains a reference to one and only one session object.
This class is never instantiated by the caller directly. Call the static method SingleConnectionSession.GetInstance() to get an instance of a session.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IJobFactory.RemoveJob(Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Job)
member.summary: Removes a user defined Job object created by this user defined job factory.
member.remarks: For objects that are not created by this factory, this method should do nothing and return false.
member.param: The job to remove.
member.returns: true if the job was a job created by this user defined job factory and was deleted, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IJobFactory.CreateJob(Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.JobType)
member.summary: Creates a user defined job object according to the user Job type passed in.
member.param:
The type of job to create - in the ranges of
JobType.UserImageAndRecordJobType1 through JobType.UserImageAndRecordJobTypeLast, or
JobType.UserProductionOnlyJobType1 through JobType.UserProductionOnlyJobTypeLast, or
JobType.UserImageOnlyJobType1 through JobType.UserImageOnlyJobTypeLast
member.returns: Reference to a user defined Job object. Only objects of user defined job types should be created by the user defined job factory, for all other Job types NULL should be returned.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IJobFactory
member.summary: An interface that a client application implements to create user defined Job objects.

remarks.para: Clients are not supposed to create objects of Job classes directly, even for the user defined classes. A client application implements this interface and calls ClientSession.SetUserJobFactory() method. The user defined job factory needs to delete all of the Job objects created in CreateJob() method in the RemoveJob() method.
Note: Rapid API uses its own job factory for all the predefined Job types.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.summary: Callback method, provides a chance for a client to modify the current Order XML string before it is submitted to server.
member.param: The modifier holding the current XML string.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IXmlModifyListener
member.summary: An interface used to modify order XML directly without writing customized Job classes or XML Writer classes.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.XmlStrModifier.ReplaceXmlString(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the original XML string with the new XML string.
member.param: The new formatted XML string replacing the original XML string. Note that if the new XML string cannot be different type of XML from the original, i.e., an ImageOrder string can't be changed to ProductionOrder string. If any verification of the new XML string fails, RimageException will be thrown.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.XmlStrModifier.GetXmlStringType
member.summary: Returns the type of the XML string.
member.returns: The type of the XML string. If the string is invalid, return LastJobXmlStringType

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.XmlStrModifier.ToString
member.summary: Returns the formatted XML string.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.XmlStrModifier
member.summary:
This class is used to override an order XML string before it's submitted, providing a way of modifying generated XML without writing customized XmlWriter classes.
Before an order XML order is sent to the server, RAPID calls OnModifyOrderXml() method of IXmlModifyListener if the client sets an object of this class to the session. If needed, the client can modify this object and save the changes made, then the modified XML string will be used for order submission.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ISessionStatusListener.OnServerAlert(System.String,System.String,System.String,Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ServerAlert)
member.summary: Callback method, provides information about the current state of a specific ServerAlert. To find out if it's a newly posted alert or an acknowledged alert call ServerAlert.State.
member.param: Specifies the Id of the Connection this event is related to. The connection Id is in the 'host:port' format.
Specifies the Id of the Server this state is related to.
Specifies the Id of the ServerAlert this state is related to.
Specifies the actual ServerAlert object.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ISessionStatusListener.OnServerState(System.String,System.String,Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Server)
member.summary: Callback method, provides information about the current state of a specific Server. To find out the server's state call Server.State.
member.param: Specifies the Id of the Connection this event is related to. The connection Id is in the 'host:port' format.
Specifies the Id of the Server this state is related to.
Specifies actual Server object.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ISessionStatusListener.OnConnectionStatus(System.String,Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ConnectionStatusType,System.String)
member.summary: Callback method, provides information related to connection-wide events.
member.param: Specifies the Id of the Connection this event is related to. The connection Id is in the 'host:port' format.
Specifies what event is being sent. Values can be ConnectionStatusType.Disconnected, ConnectionStatusType.Connected, ConnectionStatusType.ConnectionBroken. Refer to SessionEnums.h.

Specifies the message of the callback, which is context sensitive to the statusType. It is the error message if the statusType is Disconnected, it is the name of the cluster if it's Cluster Created or Deleted.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ISessionStatusListener
member.summary: An interface that a client application implements to be asynchronously notified of various system statuses and alerts.

remarks.para: Client application creates an object which implements this interface and sets up a listener by calling a ClientSession.SetSessionStatusListener() method. This is typically done right after a connection to a messaging server is established. Once a listener is set up, the client application will be notified of connection, server, and alert state changes and other system related information. String identifiers are passed into each of the interface's callback methods. Each method contains all the relevent Ids to allow the client application to find any object related to the callback.

Note: Client application's methods which implement this interface should not throw exceptions back to Rapid API. If an exception is thrown, it will be logged and the API will go on as if nothing happened.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IXmlWriterFactory
member.summary: An interface that a client application implements to create user extended XmlOrderWriter objects.

remarks.para: Clients are not supposed to create objects of XmlOrderWriter classes directly, even for the user defined classes. A client application implements this interface and calls ClientSession.SetUserXmlWriterFactory() method. The user defined xml writer factory needs to delete all of the xml writer objects created in CreateImageXmlWriter() and CreateProductionXmlWriter() methods in the RemoveWriter() method.
Note: Rapid API uses its own xml writer factory for all the predefined XmlWriter types.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.XmlWriter
member.summary: A super class for various XML classes for creating XML strings used by the Rapid API.

remarks.para: Each XML class has a specific DTD file that it must conform to. A client may subclass from ImageXmlWriter and/or ProductionXmlWriter if it is altering the way order XML needs to be formated. XmlWriter itself can be subclassed in case of custom server request XML strings - this is rare.
Note: Objects of XmlWriter and its subclasses cannot be created directly, instead they should be created using IXmlWriterFactory.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: P:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.SystemFolder
member.summary: Gets Rimage System Folder as reported by the messaging server currently connected to.
member.remarks: By default the Rimage System Folder is "C:\Rimage".
member.returns: System folder for the connection, can be in UNC format, if connected, otherwise NULL.

member.name: P:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.ConnectionId
member.summary: Gets ID of the Connection.
member.returns: Connection ID in the form "host:port" if connected, otherwise NULL.

member.name: P:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.Port
member.summary: Gets string form of the port of the Connection
member.remarks: This is the same port as the one passed into ClientSession.Connect() method.
member.returns: Messaging server port if connected, otherwise NULL.

member.name: P:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.Host
member.summary: Gets computer name of the messaging server currently connected to.
member.remarks: This is the same host as the one passed into ClientSession.Connect() method.
member.returns: Messaging server computer name if connected, otherwise NULL.

member.name: P:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.ClientId
member.summary: Gets the client ID for this Connection.
member.remarks: This is the same client ID as the one passed into ClientSession.Connect() method.
member.returns: Client ID for this connection if connected, otherwise NULL.

member.name: P:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.Connected
member.summary: Checks to see if a messaging server connection exists and is active.
member.returns: true if the connection is still alive, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.RemoveOfflineServers
member.summary: Removes offline Server objects, for this connection, from Rapid APIs internal lists.
member.remarks: Main reason for calling this method is to free application's memory.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.GetServer(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a specific server object with the given server ID.
member.param: Server ID for the intended server.
member.returns: A reference to a Server object if successful, NULL if no server exists for the given server ID.
member.exception: Thrown if the server ID is invalid.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.GetPendingOrders(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a temporary collection of pending ServerOrder object references to enable enumeration inside a foreach loop.
member.remarks: ServerOrder enumerable allows enumeration over pending ImagingOrder, ProductionOrder or OrderSet objects.
member.param: Name of the cluster (queue) which contains the pending orders.

Specifies maximum number of orders to return. If maxOrders=-1, all orders in the cluster are returned. If maxOrders=20 and a cluster has 100 orders, only 20 are returned. If maxOrders=20 and a cluster has only 10 orders, then only 10 are returned.
Filters returned orders for the clientId specified. If clientId is NULL, orders for all clients will be returned.
Filters returned orders for the target serverId specified. If serverId is NULL, orders targeted for all servers will be returned.
If true then only orders specifically targeted for the specified server are returned, otherwise orders that are not targeted to a server are returned as well. Defaulted to true.
member.exception: Thrown in case of a network or an internal problem.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.GetServers
member.summary: Initializes a temporary collection of Server object references to enable enumeration inside a foreach loop.
member.returns: Reference to initialized Server IEnumerable object.
member.exception: Thrown in case of a network or an internal problem.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.StopServer(System.String)
member.summary: Shuts down an existing online server. This is a convenient method to shutdown an online server object without having to acquire the Server object.
member.param: ID of the server to shut down.
member.remarks: If a server with the specified ID does not exist, this function does nothing.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.StartServer(System.String,Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ServerType)
member.summary: Starts a Rimage sever on a specific computer, specified by server type.
member.remarks: This method is asynchronous - it returns as soon as it initiates the server start process, which could take a while. To check if the intended server actually starts, use ISessionStatusListener to monitor server state. If a server with the specific host name and server type already existed, this method does nothing.
member.param: Name of the computer on which to start the server.
Type of the server to start - ProductionServerType or ImagingServerType.
member.exception: Thrown when the server name is invalid, the server does not exist, or the server is in an error state.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.RecoverDurableJobs
member.summary: Recovers all previously in process jobs on this connection.
member.remarks: This method recovers job statuses for jobs that were in process when the caller application either shutdown or disconnected.
member.returns: Enumerator of recovered job ids of this connection.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.SubmitDurableJob(Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Job)
member.summary: Submits a job for processing, with the option of recovering statuses in case of a shutdown.
member.remarks: Rapid API validates parameters set on the job for correctness before it sends the job to the servers for processing.
member.param: Created job object through various Job creation methods of ClientSession.
member.exception: Thrown in one of the following cases: No valid connection, job object is null, the job is already in process, job validation fails, or internal error.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection.SubmitJob(Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Job)
member.summary: Submits a job for processing.
member.remarks: Rapid API validates parameters set on the job for correctness before it sends the job to the servers for processing.
member.param: Created job object through various Job creation methods of ClientSession.
member.exception: Thrown in one of the following cases: no valid connection, job object is NULL, the job is already in process, job validation fails, or internal error.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Connection
member.summary: Connection class encapsulates information about a connection to the messaging server and allows operations that are specific to this connection, such as enumerating servers connected to the same messaging server or submitting a job to those servers. You must have a valid connection to submit jobs and monitor system status, even if a lot of those operations are performed through the SingleConnectionSession class. A connection object is automatically created when the method SingleConnectionSession.Connect() is called.

remarks.para: Client application almost never interacts with the Connection object in the "single connection" case. A Connection object can be retrieved by calling the SingleConnectionSession.GetConnection() method.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ImageAndRecordJob
member.summary: Represents the type of job which images data and produces a disc in one fell swoop.

remarks.para:
This class extends the Job class and implements the IImageOptions and IProductionOptions interfaces. More specific image and record job types are represented by these subclasses:
ISOJob
UDFJob
HybridJob
BlueBookJob
HFSJob

For setting and getting imaging related data and parameters refer to IImageOptions documentation. For setting and getting production related data and parameters refer to IProductionOptions documentation.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ProductionOnlyJob.GetProductionXml(System.String)
member.summary: Creates the XML string to be used in submitting the job to Rimage Production server. Before the XML string is formatted, the SetDefaultFields() and Validate() methods are called.
member.param: The full path of the DTD folder that holds the ProductionOrder DTD file.
member.returns: The formatted XML string according to the correct version of ProductionOrder DTD.
member.exception: Thrown if validation fails.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ProductionOnlyJob
member.summary: Represents the type of job which records an existing image on a disc and optionally prints a label.

remarks.para:
This class extends the Job class and implements the IProductionOptions interface. More specific production only job types are represented by these subclasses:
AudioJob
LabelOnlyJob
BlueBookFromImageJob
FromImageJob
For setting and getting production related data and parameters refer to IProductionOptions documentation.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.HFSImageOnlyJob

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IProductionOptions
member.summary: This inteface exposes methods to set and get data and parameters related to producing discs.

remarks.para:
Specific job classes which implement this interface are:
ImageAndRecordJob
ProductionOnlyJob Three categories of methods are exposed by this interface:
To set and get parameters use SetProductionParam() and GetProductionParam() methods. These methods either set or get a value based on a parameter key, which are detailed in JobEnums.h
To set and get data parameters specific to that data, such as AddAudioTrack(), use SetAudioTrackParam() and GetAudioTrackParam(). These methods set or add files (specified by a full path). They also allow setting and getting of parameters specific to the file - in which case not only the paramater key but also the original file path needs to be specified. Adding or setting data methods, such as AddAudioTrack(), offer a second parameter to specify whether the API should convert the given file path to UNC. This is advantageous if the server processing the job is running on a different computer on the network.
To enumerate over audio tracks and data tracks use GetAudioTracks() and GetDataTracks() methods.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IImageOptions
member.summary: This inteface exposes methods to set and get data and parameters related to creating an image.

remarks.para:
Specific job classes which implement this interface are:
ImageAndRecordJob
ImageOnlyJob

Three categories of methods are exposed by this interface:
To set and get parameters use SetImageParam() and GetImageParam() methods. These methods either set or get a value based on a parameter key, which are detailed in JobEnums.h
To set and get data parameters specific to that data, such as AddParentFolder(), SetParentFolderParam(), and GetParentFolderParam(). These methods set or add files (specified by a full path). They also allow setting and getting of parameters specific to the file - in which case not only the paramater key but also the original file path needs to be specified. Adding or setting data methods, such as AddParentFolder(), offer a second parameter to specify whether the API should convert the given file path to UNC. This is advantageous if the server processing the job is running on a different computer on the network.
To enumerate parent folders and edit lists use GetParentFolders() and GetEditListEnumers() methods.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Job.JobClassNameToJobType(System.String)

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Job
member.summary: Represents a Rapid API job and exposes methods for setting and getting job parameters. Job is the base class for all the different job types that are offered by the Rapid API.

remarks.para:
There are three main types of jobs - Image only, Production only, and Image and Record. There are also predefined subclasses for each of the three main Job classes. To create a specific type of Job, use one of the following ClientSession methods:
ClientSession.CreateImageAndRecordJob() to create ImageAndRecordJob and its subclasses.
ClientSession.CreateImageOnlyJob() to create ImageOnlyJob and its subclasses,
ClientSession.CreateProductionOnlyJob() to create ProductionOnlyJob and its subclasses,
Refer to JobEnums.h for more detail on job types.

Three main classes which extend the Job class, namely ImageAndRecordJob, ImageOnlyJob, and ProductionOnlyJob, implement one or two interfaces - IImageOptions and IProductionOptions. These interfaces specify the contract for jobs that are to be processed by Imaging server, Production server, or both.
IImageOptions interface exposes methods for specifying data to be imaged as well as settings which control how that data is to be imaged - ISO Level 2 or UDF Version 102 for example. ImageAndRecordJob and ImageOnlyJob classes implement this interface because both of these job types involve imaging of data
IProductionOptions interface has methods which allow specifying information such as the label file, the list of audio or data tracks to burn on the disc, and production settings such as media type and number of copies to make. ImageAndRecordJob and ProductionOnlyJob classes implement this interface because both of these job types use Production server to make a disc

The Job class and its subclasses offer a consistent way to set and get job parameters. The API groups similar parameters into categories. Each category is represented by a setter and getter methods as well as by an enumerated type. The enumerated type encapsulates the possible parameters for the category. All the parameter setter and getter methods follow the same pattern:
void SetSomethingParam(EnumType key, String value)
String GetSomethingParam(EnumType key) where the key is one of the enums from JobEnums.h and the value is a string. Sometimes the values can be free form, sometimes they are either RAPID_TRUE or RAPID_FALSE, and at other times the value needs to be one of the predefined strings. Appropriate values for every param are detailed in JobEnums.h.
Job.SetJobParam() and Job.GetJobParam() methods are common to all job types.
IImageOptions.SetImageParam() and IImageOptions.GetImageParam() methods are common to all jobs which create an image.
IProductionOptions.SetProductionParam() and IProductionOptions.GetProductionParam() methods are common to all jobs which produce discs.

The Rapid API Job class and its subclasses encapsulate all of the information about a job, including the job's status. Every Job object maintains a reference to a JobStatus object, whether the job has already been submitted or not. The status object can be queried at any time for the progress of the job.

Another way to monitor a job's progress of course is to set up job listeners. If a listener is set up, a default one or a job specific one, the application will be notified asynchronously with a callback to the IJobStatusListener.OnStatus() method every time the status changes. The job ID and a reference to the JobStatus object for that job are passed into the callback method. It is much more efficient to be notified through a listener vs. polling for job status proactively.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IJobStatusListener.OnJobStatus(System.String,Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.JobStatus)
member.summary: Callback method, provides the job status for a particular job.
member.param: ID of the job that the job status is related to.
Reference to a copy of the real job status for the particular job. This object is temporary, and therefore should not be stored by the client application for later use.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.IJobStatusListener
member.summary: An interface that a client application implements to be asynchronously notified of job status.

remarks.para: Client application creates an object which impelements this interface and sets up a listener by calling a ClientSession.SetDefaultJobListener() method or by calling the corresponding method of the Job class.

Note: Client application's methods which implement this interface should not throw exceptions back to Rapid API. If an exception is thrown, it will be logged and the API will go on as if nothing happened.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.JobStatus
member.summary: Represents a snap shot in time of job status. Exposes methods for getting various status information.

remarks.para: JobStatus is part of a Job object, it exists for the life time of the Job. A client should not try to delete JobStatus objects. The JobStatus objects provided in OnJobStatus() of IJobStatusListener are temporary copies of the real JobStatus object of the given job. They are temporary and should not be stored for later use by the client.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ProductionServer
member.summary: Represents a Rimage Production server and exposes methods specific to the Production server.

remarks.para: ProductionServer extends the Server class and adds functionality specific to the Production server. ProductionServer typically controlls one or more Rimage Autoloaders. An Autoloader typically contains disc input and output bins, a number of recorders, and a printer. ProductionServer allows the caller to get information about all of these elements as well as make setting changes.

The methods conforming to the 'GetNum*()" signature, such as GetNumAutoloaders(), return the counts of various components (recorders, bins, etc.). Once the count of a specific component is known methods which take component indexes can be used. These include query methods such as GetAutoloaderInfo(), GetRecorderInfo(), SetAutoloaderParam(), and GetBinParam() as well as setter methods such as SetAutoloaderParam() and SetBinParam().

There are settings that don't pertain to any specific element of the Autoloader, but effect the ProductionServer as a whole. Methods GetProductionParam() and SetProductionParam() allow for querying and changing these settings on the server. These methods are overloaded to take in different enumerated types as keys. Key values are grouped into several enum constructs to produce logical groupping of settings.
To change ProductionServer settings use multiple Set*Param() calls (be it SetProductionParam() or SetAutoloaderParam(), etc.) followed by a call to CommitParamChanges() method.
To get ProductionServer specific read-only information use RefreshInfo() and GetProductionInfo() methods.
Refer to Server class for more information on what you can do with this class.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

Refer to Server class for more information on what you can do with this class.

member.summary: Sends a server request xml to the server for execution. To get the response xml, call the GetXml() method.

In those cases a client application writer would create the xml request string conforming to either the ImageServerRequest or the ProductionServerRequest DTD. member.param: Specifies the xml string conforming to either the ImageServerRequest or the ProductionServerRequest DTD.
Specifies number of milliseconds to wait before there is no response and then timeout.

member.summary: Sets a password on the server.
member.remarks:
Note: Certain operations on a server can be password protected. If a passwod has not been set on a server then these operations are not secured. Here is the list of those methods:
SetParam() / CommitParamChanges() combination, Pause(), Resume(), Stop(), ChangeActiveOrderQuantity(), CancelActiveOrder(), SuspendActiveOrder(), ResumeActiveOrder().
member.param: Specifies the current password.
Specifies the new password to set on this server.
member.exception: Thrown if VerifyPassword() has not been called on this server or in case of a network or an internal problem.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.Server
member.summary: Represents a Rimage server and exposes methods for managing and querying the server.

remarks.para: Server is a base class for two concrete server types - ImagingServer and ProductionServer. Server objects are never instantiated directly, instead a Server object is instantiated by Rapid API when a specific Server comes on line. An event is also sent to the application if an ISessionStatusListener interface is implemented and set up using the ClientSession class.
To manage Server states use Pause(), Resume(), and Stop() methods.
To get Server read-only information use RefreshInfo() and GetInfo() methods.
To read Server settings use RefreshParams() and GetParam() methods.
To change Server settings use multiple SetParam() calls followed by a call to CommitParamChanges() method.

Server alerts (represented by ServerAlert and ServerError classes) are attached to a Server object by RAPID when they are sent out by a Rimage server. To see all the active alerts use the GetAlerts() method. An event for a new or acknowledged alert is sent to the application as well, if an ISessionStatusListener interface is implemented and set up using the ClientSession class.

Server class allows you to work with orders that are currently active on the server. These orders can be initiated by any client application on the network - not necessarily yours. Orders are represented by ServerOrder base class and ImagingOrder and ProductionOrder concrete classes. To see all orders currently active on a server use the GetActiveOrders() method. An application can also CancelActiveOrder(), SuspendActiveOrder(), and ResumeActiveOrder() server orders. To change number of copies use ChangeActiveOrderQuantity() method.
For information on specific Servers refer to ImagingServer and ProductionServer classes.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ServerOrder
member.summary: Represents an order that has been submitted to the system by a client application, not necessarily this one.
member.remarks:
A Rapid API Job can consist of 1 or 2 orders which are hidden from the caller. Rimage servers however work on orders, not Jobs. An order can be either Imaging or Production. Both of these extend the ServerOrder base class.
Server orders are attached to a Server object by Rapid API after a call to Server.RefreshInfo(RefreshActiveOrders) has been made. To see all the active orders use the GetActiveOrders() method on a specific Server object.
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ServerAlert.GetReplyActionId(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Returns the action Id for the requested reply. This is the unique value assigned to every possible reply for every possible ServerAlert that can be produced by a Rimage server.
member.remarks:
The possible action Ids are:
1 - "OK"
2 - "Retry"
3 - "Yes"
4 - "No"
5 - "Cancel"
6 - "Reject Disc"
7 - "Retry or Pass"
8 - "Pass Disc"
9 - "Stop Line"
10- "End Job"
11- "Abort Job"
12- "Disable Autoloader"
13- "Disable Printer"
14- "Disable Recorder"
member.param: Specifies the 0 based index of the reply to send back to the server, typically 0, 1, or 2.
member.returns: Action Id for the specific reply.
member.exception: Thrown in case of invalid index or an internal problem.

member.param: Specifies the 0 based index of the reply to send back to the server, typically 0, 1, or 2.
member.returns: Meaningful action text for the specific reply.
member.exception: Thrown in case of invalid index or an internal problem.

member.name: M:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ServerAlert.GetNumReplies

member.name: P:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ServerAlert.State

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ServerAlert
member.summary: Represents a Rimage server alert and exposes methods for managing that alert.
member.remarks:
Server alerts come in two flavors: Alerts and Errors. ServerAlerts represent Warning severity and ServerErrors represent error severity. Alerts and Errors are sent out by Rimage servers when an alert or an error condition is reached. An example would be 'Input bin is empty'.
Server alerts and errors are attached to a Server object by the Rapid API when they are sent out by a Rimage server. To see all the active alerts use the GetAlerts() method on either a specific Server object or on a ClientSession instance. An event for a new or acknowledged alert is sent to the application as well, if an ISessionStatusListener interface is implemented and set up using the ClientSession class.
Alerts and Errors are not just informational, instead they require a response from the user. In the case of 'Input bin empty' alert, an operator, on seeing an alert dialog, would refill the input bin and then reply to the server by clicking one of the buttons presented on the dialog. ServerAlert class is in either AlertPosted or AlertAcknowledged state.
The typical use case for handling alerts is as follows:
1) Server sends out an alert.
2) Client application receives the notification of the alert in ISessionStatusListener::OnServerAlert() callback method.
3) Client application displays the alert in a dialog. The dialog shows buttons with corresponding strings received from GetNumReplies() and GetReplyText() methods.
4) An operator resolves the alert condition (places more blank discs in the input bin for example).
5) The operator clicks on one of the buttons which triggers a call to one of the Reply Server methods which are listed below.
6) The server receives the reply, checks that the condition has been fixed and sends out an alert acknowledgement.
7) Client application receives the alert acknowledgement through the ISessionStatusListener::OnServerAlert() with AlertAcknowledged value.
There are three methods to choose from to reply to a ServerAlert:
ReplyWithActionId()
ReplyWithText()
ReplyWithIndex()
Rimage Corporation, Copyright (c) 2007 - 2012

member.name: F:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.LabelFileParamType.PerfectPrintAngleParam
member.summary: Parameter key for setting and getting the flag of Perfecting Print Angle. Note that the angle is the string form of deceimal numbers, such as "25553.4549999". The integral part is modulized by 360 (25553 \% 360) = 353, and the decimal portion is rounded to nearest .25 (in this case, it's rounded to 0.50). So the actual angle is set to "353.50".

member.summary: Logon id of the process that started the Streamer. If the Streamer is started by eIS or DiscFlow, the logon id is 'RimageServices' Default is 'RimageServices'.

member.summary: Flag to indicate how Imager uses Streamer, false if started by the client API and true if started by eIS or DiscFlow. Default is 'true'.

member.name: F:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ImagingJobParamType.ImagerStreamerHostParam
member.summary: Optional parameter key for setting and getting the computer name of the streamer that Imaging server will use to stream the data to create an image. If this is not set no streaming will be performed.

member.name: F:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ImagingJobParamType.IncludeSpanFilesParam
member.summary:
Parameter key for IncludeSpanFiles, optional, default to ParamValues.True. If ParamValues.True, every disc in a spanned set includes the manifest and spanrestore files. If ParamValues.False, the manifest and spanrestore files are not included. If "IfSpanned" is used, the manifest and spanrestore files are included only if the spanned set is more than one disc. Possible values are:
ParamValues.True
ParamValues.False
"IfSpanned"

member.name: F:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.ImagingJobParamType.SplitFileIfOverParam
member.summary: SplitFileIfOver allows the caller to specify a file size in bytes.
member.remarks: Files under this size will never be split. Files over this size will only be split if they fall on a volume boundary.

members.member: Parameter key for setting and getting the allow spanning flag. Possible values are ParamValues.True and ParamValues.False, ParamValues.False is default. IImageOptions.AllowSpanning() and IImageOptions.IsSpanning() methods are equivalent.

member.name: F:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.JobParamType.DeleteDurableJobFileAfterFinishingParam
member.summary: Applies to Durable jobs only. Parameter key for setting and getting the the flag to indicate if the user wants RAPID to delete the durable job file after job COMPLETED, CANCELED or FAILED. This parameter is defauled to 'TRUE' or not set. If this parameter is set to 'FALSE', the job file would not be removed until the user calls RemoveFinsihedJobs().

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.AutoBulkReadingParamType
member.summary: Represents possible types of settings returned with ProductionServer.GetProductionParam(AutoBulkReadingParamType) and set with ProductionServer.SetProductionParam(AutoBulkReadingParamType) methods.

member.name: F:Rimage.Rapid.Dotnet.Api.AutoBulkReadingParamType.ExtractionFiltersParam
member.summary: The ExtractionFilters value should contain a semi-colon separated list of filters. To select a specific file, name its full path from the root as follows: "\Dir A\Dir B\Filename.ext". To select a specific folder, name its full path ending with a backslash as follows: "\Dir A\Dir B\". This will capture all files and sub-folders in 'Dir B'. To select all files with a specific extension, use "*.ext". To select all extentions of a file with a specific name, use "name.*". To select all files with a specific extension under a specific folder, use "\Dir A\*.ext". To select all extentions of a file with a specific name under a specific folder, use "\DirA\name.*".

member.summary: WaitForSpace causes the Imaging server to wait for the image size plus the amount of free space specified in Mbytes to be available before the image is made. Value of -1 means return error if not enough space.

member.summary: If 'true' then Imaging server allows existing image files to be overwritten with new ones, if 'false' then this condition results in error.

member.name: F:PerfectPrintAngleParam
member.summary: Parameter key for setting and getting the flag of Perfecting Print Angle. Note that the angle is the string form of deceimal numbers, such as "25553.4549999". The integral part is modulized by 360 (25553 \% 360) = 353, and the decimal portion is rounded to nearest .25 (in this case, it's rounded to 0.50). So the actual angle is set to "353.50".

member.name: F:ImagerStreamerLogonIdParam
member.summary: Logon id of the process that started the Streamer. If the Streamer is started by eIS or DiscFlow, the logon id is 'RimageServices' Default is 'RimageServices'.

member.summary: Flag to indicate how Imager uses Streamer, false if started by the client API and true if started by eIS or DiscFlow. Default is 'true'.

member.name: F:ImagerStreamerHostParam
member.summary: Optional parameter key for setting and getting the computer name of the streamer that Imaging server will use to stream the data to create an image. If this is not set no streaming will be performed.

member.name: F:IncludeSpanFilesParam
member.summary:
Parameter key for IncludeSpanFiles, optional, default to RAPID_TRUE. If RAPID_TRUE, every disc in a spanned set includes the manifest and spanrestore files. If RAPID_FALSE, the manifest and spanrestore files are not included. If "IfSpanned" is used, the manifest and spanrestore files are included only if the spanned set is more than one disc. Possible values are:
RAPID_TRUE
RAPID_FALSE
"IfSpanned"

member.name: F:SplitFileIfOverParam
member.summary: SplitFileIfOver allows the caller to specify a file size in bytes.
member.remarks: Files under this size will never be split. Files over this size will only be split if they fall on a volume boundary.

members.member: Parameter key for setting and getting the allow spanning flag. Possible values are RAPID_TRUE and RAPID_FALSE, RAPID_FALSE is default. IImageOptions.AllowSpanning() and IImageOptions.IsSpanning() methods are equivalent.

member.name: F:DeleteDurableJobFileAfterFinishingParam
member.summary: Applies to Durable jobs only. Parameter key for setting and getting the the flag to indicate if the user wants RAPID to delete the durable job file after job COMPLETED, CANCELED or FAILED. This parameter is defauled to 'TRUE' or not set. If this parameter is set to 'FALSE', the job file would not be removed until the user calls RemoveFinsihedJobs().

member.name: F:ExtractionFiltersParam
member.summary: The ExtractionFilters value should contain a semi-colon separated list of filters. To select a specific file, name its full path from the root as follows: "\Dir A\Dir B\Filename.ext". To select a specific folder, name its full path ending with a backslash as follows: "\Dir A\Dir B\". This will capture all files and sub-folders in 'Dir B'. To select all files with a specific extension, use "*.ext". To select all extentions of a file with a specific name, use "name.*". To select all files with a specific extension under a specific folder, use "\Dir A\*.ext". To select all extentions of a file with a specific name under a specific folder, use "\DirA\name.*".

member.summary: If 'true' then Imaging server allows existing image files to be overwritten with new ones, if 'false' then this condition results in error.

member.name: T:Rimage.Rapid.Api.ServerOrderStageType
member.summary: Represents possible stages a server order can be in.

member.name: F:CompletedStage
member.summary: An order is completed.

member.name: F:Cancelling
member.summary: An order is in the process of being cancelled.

member.name: F:Segment
member.summary: An order is a segmented order and the server is waiting for the next segment.

member.name: F:Suspended
member.summary: An order is suspended, can be resumed later.

member.name: F:Suspending
member.summary: An order is in the process of being suspended.

member.name: F:Reading
member.summary: A master disc is being read.

member.name: F:Mapping
member.summary: A master disc is being read.

member.name: F:Printing
member.summary: A label is being printed on a disc for an order.

member.name: F:Destroying
member.summary: A disc is being destroyed, this could happen for a variety of reasons.

member.name: F:Fixating
member.summary: A disc is at the end of being recorded for an order.

member.name: F:Recording
member.summary: A disc is being recorded for an order.

member.name: F:Downloading
member.summary: Data for an order is being received by the Production server.

member.name: F:Imaging
member.summary: Order is in the imaging stage on the Imaging server.

member.name: F:Busy
member.summary: Order is waiting for resources on a server.

member.name: F:Waiting
member.summary: Order is waiting for resources on a server.

member.summary: Order is being worked on by a server.

member.summary: Order failed processing on the server.

member.name: F:Cancelled
member.summary: Order has been cancelled by the user.

member.name: F:Completed
member.summary: Order is finished successfully.

member.name: F:Pending
member.summary: Order is waiting to be picked up by a server for processing.
